net.proteusframework.ui.miwt

Class ButtonGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.ButtonGroup
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<AbstractButton>

    public class ButtonGroup
extends Object
implements Iterable<AbstractButton>

    This class is used to create a multiple-exclusion scope for a set of buttons. Creating a set of buttons with the same ButtonGroup object means that turning "on" one of those buttons turns off all other buttons in the group.

    A ButtonGroup can be used with any set of objects that inherit from AbstractButton. Typically a button group contains instances of RadioButton or ToggleButton. It wouldn't make sense to put an instance of PushButton or TextButton because these components do not use the selected state.

    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)
